title: 111_hr1182
content: The Act titled "Military Spouses Residency Relief Act" guarantees residency for military personnel spouses for voting purposes. The Servicemembers Civil Relief Act is amended to include provisions for spouses of military personnel regarding voting for Federal, State, or local offices. Spouses accompanying their military partners in compliance with orders will not lose their residency or domicile in a State solely due to their absence. The Servicemembers Civil Relief Act is amended to include provisions for spouses of military personnel regarding voting for Federal, State, or local offices. The table of contents is updated to reflect the changes. The Servicemembers Civil Relief Act is amended to guarantee residency for military personnel and their spouses. This applies to absences from specified States on or after the enactment date, regardless of the military or naval order date. Additionally, there are provisions for determining the tax residence of military personnel's spouses. The Servicemembers Civil Relief Act is amended to ensure that spouses of military personnel maintain their residency for tax purposes when accompanying the servicemember on military orders. The Servicemembers Civil Relief Act is amended to exempt the income of military spouses from being considered taxable if they are not residents of the jurisdiction where the income is earned due to accompanying their servicemember spouse on military orders. The amendments to section 511 of the Servicemembers Civil Relief Act will apply to State or local income tax returns starting from the enactment date of this Act. SEC. 4. The Servicemembers Civil Relief Act is amended to suspend the land rights residency requirement for spouses of military personnel. This applies to servicemembers in military service on or after the enactment date of this Act.
